question: You must use your seat belt:
a: Unless you are riding in a vehicle built before 1978
b: Unless you are riding in a limousine
c: And failure to do so may result in a traffic ticket
d: Only when driving on a highway
answer: And failure to do so may result in a traffic ticket

question: It is illegal for a person under 21 years of age to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is _____ or more.
a: 0.01% - One hundredth of one percent
b: 0.04% - Two hundredths of one percent
c: 0.05% - Five hundredths of one percent
d: 0.08% - Eight hundredths of one percent
answer: 0.01% - One hundredth of one percent

question: Generally speaking you are in a large truck's blind spot if you:
a: Drive close to the large truck's left front wheel
b: Cannot see the truck driver in the truck's side mirrors
c: Follow no closer than ten feet behind the large truck
d: All of the above
answer: Cannot see the truck driver in the truck's side mirrors

question: Smoking inside a vehicle when a person younger than 18 years of age is present is:
a: Legal if it is your child
b: Illegal at all times
c: Not restricted by law
d: Your choice
answer: Illegal at all times

question: The "three-second rule" applies to the space _________ of your vehicle.
a: to the sides
b: ahead
c: in back
d: all around
answer: ahead

question: When you enter traffic from a stop (ex: pulling away from the curb) you:
a: Should drive slower than other traffic for 200 feet
b: Need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic
c: Should wait for the first vehicle to pass then pull into the lane
d: Should expect other drivers to make room for you to enter traffic
answer: Need a large enough gap to get up to the speed of traffic

question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines two feet or more apart:
a: May only be crossed to enter a private driveway
b: Should be treated like a solid wall and not be crossed
c: Denote a lane for beginning or ending left-hand turns
d: Denote a center turn lane
answer: Should be treated like a solid wall and not be crossed

question: Look carefully for motorcycles before you change lanes because:
a: It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes
b: Their smaller size makes them harder to see
c: They always have the right-of-way at intersections
d: They always have the right-of-way on the highway
answer: Their smaller size makes them harder to see

question: You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn you should:
a: Turn off your engine until the person crosses the street
b: Tell the pedestrian when to cross the street
c: Wait until the person crosses the street
d: Honk the horn to warn the pedestrian of your presence
answer: Wait until the person crosses the street

question: Dim your lights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:
a: You are approaching from behind
b: Approaching you from behind
c: You have already passed
d: Parked on the shoulder of the road
answer: You are approaching from behind

question: U-turns in residential districts are legal:
a: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby
b: Across two sets of solid double yellow lines
c: On a one-way street at a green
d: At or on a railroad crossing
answer: When there are no vehicles approaching nearby

question: At night if an oncoming vehicle fails to dim its high-beams look:
a: Toward the center of the roadway
b: Toward the right edge of your lane
c: Toward the left edge of your lane
d: Straight ahead in your lane
answer: Toward the right edge of your lane

question: If you are a minor and your cell phone rings while you are driving you should:
a: Answer it if you have a hands-free device
b: Let the call go to voice mail
c: Answer if the call is from your parents
d: Text the caller that you are driving and that you will return the call later
answer: Let the call go to voice mail

question: You are at a red traffic signal. The traffic light turns green but there are still other vehicles in the intersection. You should:
a: Wait until the vehicles clear the intersection before entering
b: Move ahead only if you can go around the other vehicles safely
c: Enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear
d: Honk your horn to warn other drivers of your presence and then enter the intersection
answer: Wait until the vehicles clear the intersection before entering

question: The road surface is most slippery:
a: During a heavy rain or storm
b: Just after the rain
c: Just when it starts raining
d: During a light rain
answer: Just when it starts raining

question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
a: Road hazard sign
b: Interstate route sign
c: School crossing sign
d: Speed limit sign
answer: Road hazard sign

question: Before you reach the intersection when crossing railroad tracks in slow traffic you should:
a: Sound your horn as you are crossing the tracks
b: Stop on the tracks until your light turns green
c: Stop between the crossing gates in case they close
d: Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before you proceed
answer: Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before you proceed

question: Who is responsible for knowing how your medications affect your driving?
a: You
b: Your doctor
c: Your pharmacist
d: The DMV clerk
answer: You

question: Parallel parking is when the:
a: Front wheels are turned toward the street
b: Vehicle is in line with other parked vehicles
c: Rear wheels are touching the curb
d: Front wheels are turned against the street
answer: Vehicle is in line with other parked vehicles

question: When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
a: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
b: 5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway
c: Accelerate to reach the speed of at least 60 mph
d: The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway
answer: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway
